why aero data management systems

Huge companies

Aero Data Management Systems (ADMS) is a company created from the human value and experience in systems Civil Aviation, Air Traffic Management and Airports.

Years of experience

ADMS is composed of a human staff with 36 years of experience in various companies in the aviation environment.

Control centers and airport systems

Our staff has created installations and commissioning of over 100 control centers and airport systems worldwide.

tunisia

Management and control of Tunisia's airspace: 2 Control Centers, 5 APP Centers, 5 Control Towers. 3 PSR+MSSR Radars

morocco

Morocco Air Space: 2 Control Centers, 5 TMA's units, 5 Simulators, 6 Radars MSSR and PSR

poland

Poland's new Unified Air Traffic Management System, called Pegasus 21

ukraine

Modernization of air traffic in the Ukraine

cape verde

Air traffic management in Cape Verde

kuwait

Implement an innovative traffic monitoring system in Kuwait

oman

Oman air traffic project

Electronic Billing System

Since ADMS have a cutting edge solution that, thanks to new
technologies, allows access ensuring the usability of the systems
to be accessible to users with different roles

Technologies
  • Invoice Simulation
  • Automatic billing and invoices generation
    Dynamic invoicing Taking into account the different Customer parameters
  • Dynamic Graphics presentation
  • Analysis system for decisions support
  • Web access form the company"s intranet
  • Mobile access to check and explore all statistics information
  • Corporative Home page Updating with the latest information
  • Aeronautical Support Document Management> (ICAO, Eurocontrol, AIP, ...)
  • Repository Databases with airports, airlines, aircraft, ...
Main Characteristics

The main characteristics of the Billing System:

  • Modular system
    customizable onDemand
  • Speeds up billing process.
  • Accurate removing errors from manual processing.
  • Flexible to cover the current and future needs.
  • Automatic data collection from different systems (ATM, Airports, AFTN, ...).
  • Customizable to produce the proper charges and billing according to ad-hoc rules and formulas.
  • Scalable for using the
    system in any environment (several centres and
    aerodromes of different complexity).
The main technical advantages
  • Redundant Server based on Red Hat Linux Operating System
  • Firewall access control to ensure maximum security
  • Server based on Red Hat Linux Operating System
  • Support access database MySQL
  • Integrated with external systems (ATM, Airport Data Systems)
  • Open System. Customer will allow modification of the
    structure of the application tables
  • Access to the application code so that the client
    is capable of adapting

EBS -THE KEY TO SAVE YOUR MONEY

AIM/AIS SYSTEMS


ICAO creates a study group (20 March 2008) for the AIS to AIM transition, the Civil Aviation Authorities (CAAs) tries to implement the new AIM concepts.


The expected outputs of the study group will include a global roadmap for the transition from AIS roadmap for the transition from AIS roadmap for the transition from AIS Charts Annex 15 - Aeronautical Information Services; the Aeronautical Information Services Manual (Doc 8126); and the Aeronautical Chart Manual (Doc 8697), and the development of two new manuals related to the AIM quality system and AIM training.


http://www.icao.int/safety/ais-aimsg

Actually ADMS has experience that almost all CAAs has on planned to do the transition but the actual AIS has on planned to do the transition but the actual doesn"t allow the modular transition.


The Scope of ADMS is to offer the newest AIS/AIM System with the latest EUROCONTROL and ICAO recommendations and standards.

In the global air traffic management (ATM) system environment envisioned by the operational concept, aeronautical information service (AIS) would become one of the most valuable and important enabling services
